text.__SUMMARY__: The Mona worm snake (Antillotyphlops monensis) is a harmless blind snake species is endemic to Mona Island in the West Indies. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Geographic range: Known only from the type locality, which is given as "Mona Island, West Indies."
text.Conservation status: This species is classified as Endangered (EN) on the IUCN  Red List of Threatened Species with the following criteria: D (v2.3, 1994). This means that, even though this species is not Critically Endangered, it is facing a very high risk of extinction in the wild in the near future because the population is estimated to number less than 250 mature individuals. Year assessed: 1996.
